examples.title: python
examples.content:
import OneXAPI

user_info = {
    "accessKey":"user access key",
    "secretKey":"user secrey key"
}

# Binance Spot
client = OneXAPI.Binance.Spot(user_info)

# Binance Futures
client = OneXAPI.Binance.Futures(user_info)

# Upbit Spot
client = OneXAPI.Upbit.Spot(user_info)                  # Korea

examples.title: c++

examples.title: python
c++

Parameter.description: "PERP" or date([YYMMDD] format such as "220930", "221015") are allowed
This param depends on the exchange. Please check available intervals using getCandleIntervalCandidates

[ms]
frequent api request may exceeds rate limit, therefore apiReqInterval decides how long time to sleep between each api request

examples.title: python
examples.content:
import OneXAPI

client = OneXAPI.Binance.Futures()

request = {
    "baseCurrency":"BTC",
    "quoteCurrency":"USDT",
    "expiration":"PERP",
    "interval":"3min",
    "startTime":1659189600,
    "fetchInterval":100
}

print(client.fetchCandleHistory(request))

examples.title: python
examples.content:

client = OneXAPI.Binance.Futures()

print(client.has({}))

print(client.has({"api":"orderLimitBuy"}))

c++

Parameter.description: Client Order ID as assigned by the client
If this field exists, the requested price will be price*amplifier

examples.title: python
examples.content:
import OneXAPI

user_info = {
    "accessKey":"user access key",
    "secretKey":"user secrey key"
}

client = OneXAPI.Binance.Futures(user_info)

request = {
    "baseCurrency":"XRP",
    "quoteCurrency":"USDT",
    "expiration":"220930",
    "price":0.4348,
    "baseAmount":23.834219
}

print(client.orderLimitBuy(request))

examples.title: c++

Parameter.description: If this field is true, reconnect the websocket including the requested markets to the the markets being subscribed

[ms]
If this function does not complete within requestTimeout, it returns error

Success 200.description: If this field is empty, exchange supports only single chain or nothing. Please check exchange before withdraw or deposit crypto currency.

examples.title: python
examples.content:
import OneXAPI

user_info = {
    "accessKey":"user access key",
    "secretKey":"user secrey key"
}

client = OneXAPI.Binance.Spot(user_info)

print(client.fetchAllCurrencies())
# or
print(client.fetchAllCurrencies(""))
# or
print(client.fetchAllCurrencies({}))
